isis.stitle: DT/DTI-466 A and B Series DT/DTI/DTA-466 C Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS - BEYERS MODEL 200 PRESSURE TEST KIT (D-200)

svcproc.title: DESCRIPTION
svcproc.para:
The Pressure Test Kit (Figure 4.12)
can be used to measure intake manifold (Boost) pressure, fuel pressure, air cleaner restriction,fuel restriction, exhaust back pressure and crankcase pressure. It may also be used to test the accuracy of the gauges within the kit.

note.para: The D-100 Pressure Test Kit (ZTSE-2239) may also be used in place of the D-200. The differences are as follows: The (ZTSE-2239) has a 0-15 psi gauge and the D-200 has a 0-30 in. Hg. vacuum gauge, needle valves and adapters for pressure dampening. Fuel restriction cannot be measured using the D-100.

svcproc.para: The 0-30 psi gauge may be used to check intake manifold (Boost) pressure and fuel modulator diaphragm (Aneroid) leakage test.
The 0-30 in. Hg. vacuum gauge is used to measure fuel system inlet restriction.
The 0-60 inches of water (magnahelic) gauge may be used to measure air cleaner restriction and crankcase pressure. The water manometer may also be used for measuring crankcase pressure.
The 0-160 psi gauge is normally used to check fuel pressure.
The 0-300 psi gauge is not normally used for any engine diagnostic check.
